Content:
Hello riders and mechanics.
To start off, Iâ€™ll make it honest and simple. I love motorcycles and have had a few in my life time. But Iâ€™m not by any means an expert. I understand body mechanics for cars. Anyways, yada yada bla bla right? So above is a pic of what I would need to get info on. Firstly being a rider and not a mechanic, this is a CDI box? It doesnâ€™t have any labels/model brand etc. Iâ€™m told that I need a new module, from my electrician (Spanish guy who doesnâ€™t speak a word of English, and get around via his wife who translates) . He does general electrical work and doesnâ€™t really specialize in bikes, though heâ€™s good for it. He told me that â€œI had to get one of theseâ€ If you notice, my module or cdi box, whatever it is, has been scorched! I had flames under my butt, which I had to pull over and put them out. (Flames for paint work=ğŸ‘ actual flames=ğŸ‘). This is for a 113 ci s&s motor. Itâ€™s not made on an assembly line, so thereâ€™s no way I can truly ever go shop at a Harley store. My question is 1)what is it? CDI? Do they catch fire often? itâ€™s a six pin (actual screw driver looking heads and not flat). 2) where would a good place be to get these ? I see they apparently go for 900$ and as cheap as 12$, major difference in price clearly. Thank you for your help and happy riding

Vin
